titles: A true character of sundry trades and callings: or, A new ditty of innocent mirth. This song is new, and perfect true, there's none can this deny; for I am known, friend, to be one that scorns to tell a lye. To the tune of, Old Simon the King. This may be printed, R.P.
publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, at the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner.,
notes: Verse: "Now gentlemen sit you all merry ..."
Place, date of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
keywords: Broadsides --  England --  London --  Early works to 1800.
English wit and humor --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
